Sketching the base: Create a new sketch on the XY plane. Draw a circle centered at (0.3268, 0.3268) with a radius of 0.3268 units. Constrain the circle to be centered and to have the given radius. Extruding the base: Extrude the circle along the Z-axis by 0.6537 units to create a cylindrical shape. The height should be approximately twice the diameter. Part 2: Tapered Cylindrical Object Create a new coordinate system at (0.1089, 0.1089, 0.6537) with no rotation. The translation vector moves the origin to this new location. Sketching the base: Create a new sketch on the XY plane. Draw a circle centered at (0.2179, 0.2179) with a radius of 0.2179 units. Constrain the circle to be centered and to have the given radius. Extruding the base: Extrude the circle along the Z-axis in the opposite direction by 0.4358 units. This will cut away part of the cylinder. The height should be less than the diameter, resulting in a slightly tapered top and bottom. Part 3: Three-dimensional Rectangular Prism Create a new coordinate system at (0.2387, 0.6416, 0.6537) with no rotation. The translation vector moves the origin to this new location. Sketching the base: Create a new sketch on the XY plane. Draw a shape with the following properties: 1. Arc: Start Point (0, 0), Mid Point (0.0882, 0.0121), End Point (0.1764, 0) 2. Line: Start Point (0.1764, 0), End Point (0.2082, 0) 3. Line: Start Point (0.2082, 0), End Point (0.2082, 0.1084) 4. Line: Start Point (0.2082, 0.1084), End Point (0, 0.1084) 5. Arc: Start Point (0, 0.1084), Mid Point (0.0882, 0.0963), End Point (0, 0) Close the loop to form a five-sided polygon. Constrain the geometry so that all lines and arcs are connected. Extruding the base: Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis in the opposite direction by 0.4358 units. Join this new shape with the previously created cylindrical shapes. The extrusion depth should be 0.2082 units (half the width of the prism). This three-part CAD model assembly consists of a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, connected by a curved surface. The first part has a cylindrical shape with approximate height twice the diameter, followed by a tapered cylindrical shape, and finally, a three-dimensional rectangular prism is joined to create the final shape. The shape has a uniform thickness throughout and is centered in the coordinate system.</description>
